name: DJI Mini 2
description: With long battery life, a robust wireless connection, and 4K video, the DJI Mini 2 is the best drone you'll find for less than $500.

name: DJI Mavic Air 2
description: With a compelling mix of imaging, stability, and safety features, DJI's Mavic Air 2 is the best drone you can buy for under $1,000.

name: DJI Air 2S
description: The DJI Air 2S is a small folding drone with a premium 1-inch sensor camera, 5.4K video, and a number of automated flight and safety features, making it a pro-minded alternative to the more affordable Mavic Air 2.

name: DJI Mavic 3
description: The DJI Mavic 3 puts a Hasselblad camera in a small, folding drone. It captures stunning video and stills, but it's missing a few promised features at launch.

name: DJI FPV Combo
description: The DJI FPV Combo racing drone places an emphasis on high-speed first-person flight over imaging, making it exhilarating to use, but potentially dangerous if handled without care.

name: Parrot Anafi
description: The Parrot Anafi puts all emphasis on sizeâ€”the small, folding drone is ideal for travel, thanks to 4K video capture, a small airframe, and USB charging.

name: Autel Robotics EVO II Pro
description: The Autel EVO II Pro is a folding drone with a stable 6K camera and a remote with a built-in display, so you don't have to use a smartphone to fly it.

name: Skydio 2
description: The Skydio 2 is a high-priced drone with exceptional obstacle avoidance and follow abilities, but is held back by so-so video and short flight times.

name: DJI Inspire 2
description: If money is no object, the DJI Inspire 2 is the best drone you can buy, delivering Raw video capture at 5.2K quality, superb build quality, and top-end performance.

name: Ryze Tello
description: The Ryze Tello is a toy quadcopter flyable via smartphone or laptop (using Scratch). Its video quality isn't anything to write home about, but it's a fun tech toy and learning tool.
